group_1.textRight: ...I see. That's valuable information.
If you combine that with the fact that@Ui Tamaki came from the future...
I think this may be a new ploy by Minou...
...to alter the future.

group_1.textLeft: Alter...the future...?

group_1.textRight: If that's the case, the fact that the enemy used@such a roundabout method...
...may contain another meaning.

group_1.textLeft: ...What do you mean?

group_1.textRight: Now that the past and the future are connected,@their fates are intertwined.
The slightest change in events could result in a@time paradox.
A time paradox that could lead to catastrophe...

group_1.textLeft: Catastrophe...?

group_1.textRight: If you blindly change the future, the world itself@could be destroyed.
That's not what Minou wants.
In order to achieve the future they desire...
She doesn't have to kill Tart, just render her@helpless.
...Perhaps the enemy believes that it's worth it.

group_1.textLeft: I see...

group_1.textRight: ...Now, regarding how to escape from Purgatory...
As I told you before, what you need is@prayer petals.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, Monsieur Angel.

group_1.textRight: By collecting the petals, you can redeem yourself@and open the "Gates of Heaven."
You can then leave the barrier.

group_1.textLeft: Collect the petals...and go to the@Gates of Heaven...
...But, why do we need petals?

group_1.textRight: To begin with, the "Curse of Purgatory"...
...was a spell that could only be cast on those@who have withdrawn into their minds.
Therefore, Tart, before you were cursed...
Your spirit was already wounded and shattered@into pieces...
Or so it seems.

group_1.textLeft: Really...?
You wouldn't remember why,@or even be aware of it now.
You've gone back to your childhood,@both in appearance and mind...

group_1.textRight: Indeed... I don't feel like a holy maiden.
In fact, you're only a fragment of Tart's mind.
You need something to mend your broken spirit.
The memories of fate you've woven with others...
That would be the prayer petals.
Memories of fate...

group_1.textLeft: You mean she needs our memories?

group_1.textRight: Not your memories themselves.
I suppose I should say, the karmic relationship@between you and Tart.

group_1.textLeft: The human heart is shaped by our relationships@with others...
We're trying to restore La Pucelle's heart...
...by reestablishing those relationships.

group_1.textRight: ...Thank you, I think I understand now!

group_1.textLeft: Thus, we needed someone with the qualifications@to deliver the petals to La Pucelle.
I cast a spell to send those with qualifications@into the depths of Purgatory.
In other words, you could say that I summoned@the owners of the petals.

group_1.textRight: Someone with qualifications...?
First, they would need to be someone who@has a strong connection to Tart.
It also has to be someone living...@In other words, someone with a soul.
Otherwise, the interwoven fate won't be@engraved in their heart.
In addition, it most likely has to be a@Magical Girl.

group_1.textLeft: Huh, why?

group_1.textRight: It would be too difficult for an ordinary person.
Purgatory is a barrier that adopts the properties@of a dream.
It's not your actual body that's in there.
It's a projection of your own self-image.
It's like another you, or a three-dimensional@portrait... Do you understand?

group_1.textLeft: Another self, within a dream...?
You mean...like...an avatar?

group_1.textRight: Correct. And while leaving your Soul Gem,@the primary vessel of your soul, outside.
Only a Magical Girl would be able to freely@control their image in a dream.

group_1.textLeft: Oh...so it's not my real body.
That's why I'm dressed differently from when I@went to bed, and my ring is missing...

group_1.textRight: Seems that way.

group_1.textLeft: Before casting the spell to create an opening@in Purgatory...
I didn't know who would be summoned...
I only expected it to be Elisa, Melissa,@and myself.

group_1.textRight: After all, the only ones who would be able to@deliver the petals...
Would be Magical Girls with a connection to Tart!

group_1.textLeft: I was prepared to "dive in" from the very beginning.

group_1.textRight: ...Then...
We were also summoned by Perenelle's magic?
It appears so.
You came all the way from the distant future@for Tart's sake...?

group_1.textLeft: That's what it looks...
Huh? Hold on...
Sakurako doesn't know Tart.
And she's not even a Magical Girl...

group_1.textRight: I've been curious about that, too.
Could it be that Sakurako Hiiragi...
...dove into the barrier of her own accord?
